byline.original: By KEVIN SACK and ALAN BLINDER

abstract: Felicia Sanders, survivor of massacre at Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church in Charleston, SC, offers graphic and heart-rending testimony in trial of gunman Dylann Roof; defense lawyer David I Bruck has conceded Roof's guilt but is arguing for life sentence rather than death penalty.

headline.print_headline: At Trial, Reliving Terror in a Charleston Church
headline.main: Heart-Rending Testimony as Dylann Roof Trial Opens

snippet: Mr. Roof, 22, is accused of killing nine people at Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church in Charleston, S.C. He faces the death penalty....
lead_paragraph: Mr. Roof, 22, is accused of killing nine people at Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church in Charleston, S.C. He faces the death penalty.
